sentences.sentence: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said Ukrainian grain shipments offer hope for the world during his visit to Turkey on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Twenty-five ships have carried over 600,000 tonnes of grain since a deal was brokered between Ukraine and Russia in recent weeks, easing fears of a global food crisis as supply routes were blocked amid fighting in the Eastern European country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I was in Odessa port and saw the first hand loading on a cargo of wheat onto a ship. I was so moved watching the wheat fill up the hold of the ship. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The top prosecutor in the former administration is the most prominent person to be detained so far in connection with the 2014 disappearance of 43 students from a teaching college.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As students and relatives continue to march for justice, the motive for the abductions remains unclear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Karam's arrest comes a day after a commission of inquiries said the army bore at least partial responsibility in the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He's been charged with torture, obstruction of justice and forced disappearance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Prosecutors say they've also issued arrest warrants against a slew of other people, including army officers, local officials, police and gang members. Only partial remains of three of the students have ever been found and identified. With many questions remaining unanswered, the country's top human rights official has referred to the disappearances as a state crime.

sentences.sentence: It's the third day of strike action in the past week, with the London Underground staff staging walkouts across its stations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to Network Rail, only one in five trains are in operation across all of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps has tabled a pay rise offer to unions, but has since been refused.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the strikes have not just been carried out by rail workers, and if anything are gaining sympathy from other sectors. This Sunday workers at the port of Felixstowe in the east of England, the largest freight port in the country, will begin an eight day strike threatening to bring the UK's economy to a further standstill.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Almost 15 years after Greece plunged into a financial crisis, the country is regaining control of its economy as the European Union ends its enhanced surveillance policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The bloc had carried out quarterly assessments of Greece's public finances in exchange for debt relief payments after the nation suffered a huge recession from 2009.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: These last three years constitute, in practice, a response to the lessons of the last 12 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They forge our self-awareness and they urge us to move ahead united, armed with the truth and realistic solutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The end of the EU's enhanced surveillance will allow Greece greater freedom over its budget, as it, along with the rest of Europe, struggles with the rising cost of living and energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
